intro: Lutrostylis inermis, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features slender, hairless stems that often lie close to the ground. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is adapted to arid and sandy environments. Lutrostylis inermis is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in degraded areas.
